Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Laudatory \Laud"a*to*ry\, a. [L. laudatorius: cf. OF. laudatoire.] Of or pertaining praise, or to the expression of praise; as, laudatory verses; the laudatory powers of Dryden. --Sir J. Stephen. [1913 Webster]
laudatory adj : full of or giving praise; "a laudatory remark" [syn: {praiseful}, {praising}]
